actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 102-592.
Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 16.
Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
By request of Mr. Sensenbrenner the House passed over the measure without prejudice.
Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
By request of Mr. Sensenbrenner the House passed over the measure without prejudice.
Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
By request of Mr. Sensenbrenner the House passed over the measure without prejudice.
Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.
Having been called up and objected to, the measure was stricken from the Private Calendar and recommitted.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations

official_title: For the relief of Howard W. Waite.

summary.text: Provides that for purposes of determining the amount of civil service retirement annuity to which a named individual is entitled, such individual's service as an engineer on Navy construction projects for a specified period shall be considered creditable service.Provides that such individual shall be considered to be an annuitant enrolled under Federal employees' health benefits provisions and shall be paid from the Employees Health Benefits Fund for medical expenses incurred during a specified period.

titles.title: For the relief of Howard W. Waite.
